page.title: 03THE YALDING COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: The area contains the section of the attractive Medway valley between Yalding and Wateringbury, bordered to the east and south by Yalding Hill and Bow Hill. The rows of hop poles and of fruit trees and bushes on Yalding Hill are a pleasant sight. Oast houses are a prominent feature of the landscape, although few are now engaged in drying hops. Rivers feature prominently in Yalding and Wateringbury and in summer there is considerable boat travel. Yalding Town Bridge is, at 450 feet in length, the longest ancient stone bridge of its kind in the county. By its west side, and opening directly on to the bridge, is Bridge House. In Yalding the Yalding & Nettlestead Protection Society has improved the landscape by planting trees. Landscape is changing rapidly.
